title: 112_s3581
content: MODIFICATIONS TO CARBON DIOXIDE SEQUESTRATION CREDIT. The amendment to section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code limits the credit allowed for qualified carbon dioxide captured by carbon capture equipment at a qualified facility. The credit is capped at the national limitation allocated under subsection (f). The national limitation for the credit allowed for qualified carbon dioxide captured by carbon capture equipment is the excess of 75,000,000 metric tons over the amount captured before August 1, 2013. The national limitation for the credit allowed for qualified carbon dioxide captured by carbon capture equipment is the excess of 75,000,000 metric tons over the amount captured before August 1, 2013. The Secretary shall establish procedures for allocating the national limitation under Section 45Q of the Code. The Secretary will establish processes for allocating the national limitation for carbon capture projects and certifying approved projects. Applicants must submit applications under terms set by the Secretary. Applicants seeking allocation under this subsection must submit an application to the Secretary following established terms and conditions. The Secretary will prioritize applications based on the date of submission, giving higher priority to earlier submissions. Applications received before the established procedures are considered received on that date. Priority is given to applicants concurrently applying for certification on the same date. Priority is given to applications for certification based on the date construction commenced. Tonnage allocation is based on the amount requested in the application. Tonnage allocation is based on the amount requested in the application and the rank of the application. Projects with partial allocation can still receive forfeited tonnage. The Secretary is limited in allocating tonnage. The Secretary is limited in allocating tonnage to projects based on the projected capture of qualified carbon dioxide over a 10-year period. The Secretary allocates tonnage to projects based on the projected capture of qualified carbon dioxide over a 10-year period, subject to written contracts or disposal plans for secure geological storage. The Secretary allocates tonnage to projects based on the projected capture of qualified carbon dioxide over a 10-year period, subject to written contracts or disposal plans for secure geological storage. The amount of allocation to any project is reduced by the metric tons of carbon dioxide captured before August 1, 2013, for which a credit was allowed. No credit allowed for projects using carbon capture equipment before certification under this paragraph. Each project allocated a portion of the national limitation must submit an application for certification. Projects allocated a portion of the national limitation must submit an application for certification to the Secretary within 6 months of receiving the allocation. The construction start date is the earlier of when significant work begins on the project or when 5% of the total project cost has been spent. The Secretary may revoke a certification if an applicant makes materially inaccurate representations regarding the project or fails to timely place equipment. The Secretary may revoke a certification if there is a materially inaccurate representation or failure to timely place equipment in service for the project. The Secretary may revoke a certification if there is a materially inaccurate representation or failure to timely place equipment in service for the project. In such cases, reallocation of the allocation may occur within a specified timeframe. Reallocation of national limitation allocated to a project occurs if certification is revoked or if a taxpayer fails to obtain certification. The Secretary establishes rules for reallocation under regulations. Public disclosure is required. The Secretary establishes rules for reallocation of national limitation allocated to a project under regulations. Public disclosure of any allocation, certification, revocation, or change in project ranking is required within 30 days. The Secretary will issue an annual report summarizing credits allocated and available for allocation for projects certified under subsection (f)(3) of section 45Q(c) of the Code. Conforming amendments are made to section 45Q(c) regarding carbon capture equipment. Amendment to section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code includes changes to the 10-year credit limitation for carbon capture equipment. The amendment specifies the time period for claiming credits for qualified facilities. The amendment to section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code extends the 10-year period for claiming credits for carbon capture equipment placed in service or certified under subsection (f)(3) at qualified facilities. The definition of carbon capture equipment is also clarified in the amendment. The definition of carbon capture equipment is clarified in the amendment to section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code, which allows for credits to taxpayers performing carbon capture. The amendment to section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code clarifies that the credit for capturing qualified carbon dioxide is allowed to the taxpayer who captures and disposes of it according to specified requirements. The amendment to section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code allows a credit for capturing qualified carbon dioxide to the taxpayer who disposes of it in a manner meeting specific requirements. The amendment to section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code allows a credit for disposing of qualified carbon dioxide in a manner meeting specific requirements. Amendments include changes to sections 45Q(a) and 45Q(c) of the Code. Section 45Q of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to allow a credit for disposing of qualified carbon dioxide. Regulations issued under this section will apply only to carbon dioxide captured or disposed of after the regulation is filed with the Federal Register. The amendments made by this section apply to carbon dioxide captured after July 31, 2013.
